intro: Chadsia granitica, commonly known as the granite chadsia, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and white, which bloom during the cooler months. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to store water in its native environment. Chadsia granitica is often found growing on rocky outcrops, where it thrives in well-drained, mineral-rich soils.
